sen.j: 国魂（くにたま）とは、神道の観念の一つで、国（令制国）または国土そのものを神格化したものである。
sen.e: Kunitama is a concept of Shintoism, referring to the sanctification or spiritualization of the province (a country in the old governing system) or the land itself.

sen.j: 古来、国を治めるのは為政者だけでなく、その土地に鎮座する神の力も働いて成就されると考えられていた。
sen.e: In ancient times it was considered that the rule of each province was not only a task of statesmen alone; it could only be accomplished through the power of the unseen deity enshrined in each area or district.

sen.e: Okuninushi was also called Okunitama no kami or Utsushi kunitama no kami, supposing that kunitama no kami in each province was syncretized into Okuninushi.

sen.j: 各地の神社で開拓の祖神として祀られている大国主は、元々はその地の国魂神であったと考えられる。
sen.e: Okuninushi, worshiped as the pioneer deity of each provincial shrine, is considered that it was originally the kunitama no kami of the land.
